title: [Feature Request] show multiple plots in Tracking UI

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
## Willingness to contribute
- [ ] Yes. I can contribute this feature independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute this feature with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [x] No. I cannot contribute this feature at this time.

## Proposal Summary

User Interface (`mlflow ui`)  displaying multiple plots instead of just one.

## Motivation

Currently the Tracking UI seems to allow 1 plot only.
Multiple metrics can be plotted there, but in cases where metrics are on very different scales (e.g. different losses, learning rate, accuracy, etc.) the visualization is poor.

Switching being different metrics of interest, back-and-forth, manually, is not very user friendly.

Allowing multiple plots would improve the experiment tracking immensely.

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this feature affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [x] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interfaces
- [x] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
